hero.title: Africa's STEM Future Starts with Her
hero.description: Developing the future professional workforce in Africa by supporting African girls and women in STEM fields & careers

challenges.title: Our Challenges

imbalance.title: IMBALANCE
imbalance.description: Only 35% of African students pursue STEM subjects, with a significant gender gap. Women are underrepresented in STEM fields across the continent.

nonValuation.title: NON VALUATION
nonValuation.description: Women represent only 30% of researchers worldwide. Facing bias in peer review, grant allocation, and hiring processes by Microsoft shows that.

scarcity.title: SCARCITY
scarcity.description: Africa faces a shortage of 165K+ STEM professionals. This gap is a challenge of scale, requiring significant investment in education and training.

lossOfMoney.title: LOSS OF MONEY
lossOfMoney.description: Gender gaps in STEM reduce productivity and economic growth. Closing these gaps could increase GDP by $30 trillion worldwide by 2025.

challenges.blogCta: If you'd like to find out more about the STEM challenges Africa and African women are facing, please visit our blog by clicking on the link below.

joinUs.title: Join Us
joinUs.description: Join our vibrant community of STEM professionals and enthusiasts. We're working together to promote women in STEM fields across Africa and beyond.

contribute.title: Call for a contribution
contribute.description: Would you like to contribute to our mission? Join us in empowering African women in STEM fields by volunteering your time or making a donation.

footer.description: Empowering African women in STEM fields through education, mentorship, and networking.
